perturbation.original_text: 10. Remedies. If either party breaches any provision of this Agreement, the other party shall be entitled to seek monetary damages and, if  appropriate, equitable relief to require the performance of the obligations hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: 10. Remedies. If either party breaches any provision of this Agreement, the other party shall be entitled to seek monetary damages, but equitable relief will not be sought or granted.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause allows for both monetary damages and equitable relief. This modification restricts the remedies to only monetary damages, explicitly excluding equitable relief. This contradicts the original clause's intent and potentially limits the avenues for recourse in case of a breach, affecting its enforceability.

perturbation.original_text: 14. Termination by the Sponsor. Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 1 hereof, the Sponsor shall have the right at any time prior to  December 31, 2010 to terminate this Agreement by giving written notice of such termination to Racing. In the event of such a termination, (i) the  Sponsor shall have no further obligation to make payments toward the sponsorship fee contemplated in Section 3 hereof, (ii) Racing shall have no  further obligation to provide any Benefits hereunder, and (iii) the remaining provisions of this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect.
perturbation.changed_text:
6. Retention of Rights. The only rights granted to the Sponsor hereunder are the right to receive the Benefits, and Racing hereby retains all  other rights with respect to the Racing Team, including but not limited to logos, symbols, names and other marks and intellectual property of the  Racing Team, and any proceeds derived by the Racing Team. The Sponsor hereby retains and does not grant any rights to Racing to use any of its  logos, symbols, names or other marks or intellectual property, except for use as described in Section 2 hereof. In the event that this Agreement is  terminated or if the sponsorship terminates at the end of the term provided for herein, each of the parties shall retain the rights to use its logos,  symbols, names or other marks or intellectual property including, in the case of the Sponsor, the right to use the names and marks "GAINSCO 99",  "the GAINSCO 99 Car", or similar phrases or derivations thereof. 

14. Termination by the Sponsor. The Sponsor shall have the right at any time prior to  December 31, 2010 to terminate this Agreement by giving written notice of such termination to Racing. In the event of such a termination, (i) the  Sponsor shall have no further obligation to make payments toward the sponsorship fee contemplated in Section 3 hereof, (ii) Racing shall have no  further obligation to provide any Benefits hereunder, and (iii) this agreement will then be under review to determine the rest of the effects.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the termination clause to the Retention of Rights Section undermines its importance. Additionally, adding 'this agreement will then be under review to determine the rest of the effects' creates ambiguity about the consequences of termination, potentially conflicting with standard contract law principles where termination consequences are usually clearly defined.

perturbation.original_text: 5. Sponsor's Maximum Obligation; Indemnification. Racing represents to the Sponsor that the Sponsor's aggregate obligation hereunder  will not exceed the amount of the sponsorship fee set forth in Section 3 hereof (or such lesser amount as is payable by the Sponsor in the event  that this Agreement is terminated pursuant to Section 14 hereof), plus, if applicable, collection costs that may be reasonably incurred by Racing in  a legal proceeding to collect all or any part thereof (the "Maximum Obligation"). Racing agrees to indemnify the Sponsor and its officers, directors,  agents and employees and to hold them harmless from any loss, claim, cost, damage or liability in excess of the Maximum Obligation which (i) the  Sponsor shall incur as a result of this Agreement, or (ii) arises from any failure by Racing to perform any of its obligations hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: 5. Sponsor's Maximum Obligation; Indemnification. Racing represents to the Sponsor that the Sponsor's aggregate obligation hereunder  will not exceed the amount of the sponsorship fee set forth in Section 3 hereof (or such lesser amount as is payable by the Sponsor in the event  that this Agreement is terminated pursuant to Section 14 hereof), plus, if applicable, collection costs that may be reasonably incurred by Racing in  a legal proceeding to collect all or any part thereof (the "Maximum Obligation"). Racing agrees to indemnify the Sponsor and its officers, directors,  agents and employees and to hold them harmless from any loss, claim, cost, damage or liability in excess of the Maximum Obligation which (i) the  Sponsor shall incur as a result of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing '(ii) arises from any failure by Racing to perform any of its obligations hereunder' from the indemnification clause, Racing is no longer obligated to indemnify the Sponsor for losses arising from Racing's failure to perform its obligations. This creates a contradiction by limiting the scope of indemnification, potentially leaving the Sponsor vulnerable to losses caused by Racing's non-performance, which is a typical expectation in sponsorship agreements.
